info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL BUTLER...CENTRAL ARMSTRONG AND SOUTH CENTRAL CLARION COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Meridian, or near Butler, moving east at 75 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Butler, Kittanning, Homeacre-Lyndora, Shanor-Northvue, Meridian, Meadowood, Oak Hills, New Bethlehem, West Kittanning, Prospect, Chicora, and East Brady. This includes Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 92 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
